snippet: Robert J. Birgeneau, a former University of California, Berkeley, chancellor, withdrew from Haverford’s commencement, joining a number of others who have backed out of speaking engagements this spring in response to campus objections.
abstract: Haverford College joins growing list of schools to lose commencement speakers to protests from the left, when Robert J Birgeneau, former chancellor at University of California, Berkeley, withdraws from event; some Haverford students and faculty objected to Birgeneau because during his tenure at Berkeley, police used batons to break up a 2011 protest.
lead_paragraph: Robert J. Birgeneau, a former University of California, Berkeley, chancellor, withdrew from Haverford’s commencement, joining a number of others who have backed out of speaking engagements this spring in response to campus objections.

headline.main: In Season of Protest, Haverford Speaker Is Latest to Bow Out
headline.print_headline: In Season of Protest, Haverford Speaker Is Latest to Bow Out
